MEMORANDUM
September 19, 1957
To: Members of the Nominating Committee
Richard B. Hull, Chairman
Martha Gable
Howard L. Johnson
Harry Lamb
H. B. McCarty
James S. Miles
James Robertson
Edward Wegener
cc: Board of Directors; Harry J. Skornia
Prom: Burton Paulu
First, let me thank you for your willingness to serve on this
important committee. Since the officers of NAEB bear major
responsibility for managing the affairs of the Association, and
since the people nominated by this committee are usually those
elected, you can see that your job is an important one.
I have tried to appoint to this committee people representing
the major interests and points of view found in our Association.
There are representatives of universities, public school systems
and community television stations; people whose principal interest
is in radio and some whose major work is in television; some from
large stations and some from small; some who have been with us
for a long time, and others who are relatively new to NAEB. Taken
as a whole 1 think this committee represents an excellent cross
section of our membership.
For your information, may I quote from the minutes of the
Columbus meeting of the NAEB Board of Directors:
^As to nominating officers for the Association, recommendations
came forth that officers be nominated in advance of the
convention and that several slates be presented to the
membership. Paulu will appoint a nominating committee
prior to the St, Louis convention and suggest that the
nominations be made available sometime in advance. It
was pointed out, however, that in previous years the
nominating committee was announced early in the convention
and the membership encouraged to talk with the committee
throughout the convention.”
It didn't seem practical to make nominations ”in advance of the
convention, since the committee has to meet in order to engage in
the kind of frank discussion required, and it can't do that before
its members arrive in St. Louis. But it is possible to announce
nominations prior to voting (on the last day).
Since your names will be listed in the next Newsletter, you
probably will receive a number of suggestions from members. May
I too, therefore, make a few comments?
